Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. William Taharka Robinson, New Life Tabernacle Church, 1476 Bedford Avenue, Brooklyn, NY  11216.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cabrera.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was actually delivered by: Council Member and Pastor Fernando Cabrera of the New Life Outreach International of the Bronx, N.Y.

Council Member Barron moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 25, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lander.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lander moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 25, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 100156 ZSK, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 100155 HAK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Special Permit, Brooklyn (C100156ZSK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to establish a School Transformation Zone, based on the model proposed by the NYC Coalition for Educational Justice, to improve low-performing schools and prevent school closings.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish a School Transformation Zone.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2010 Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2010 Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certain provisions of title 17 and to repeal subchapters 1 and 5 of chapter 3, relating to permits for the sale or transfer of milk and milk products and to medical records respectively.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Permits for the sale or transfer of milk and milk products and to medical records respectively.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to repeal and reenact section 17-337 relating to air quality standards for compressed air in underwater breathing tanks.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Air quality standards for compressed air in underwater breathing tanks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the definitions of terms that relate to the provision of information on child care services and to reporting on child care programs and to repeal certain provisions of the administrative code in relation thereto.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relating to reports regarding child care facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact H.R. 4224, the “Together We Care Act of 2009,” which would establish a pilot program to train public housing residents as home health care aides and in home-based health care services to enable residents to provide covered home-based health care services to residents of public housing and residents of federally-assisted rental housing, who are elderly or persons with a disability.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to enact H.R. 4224, the “Together We Care Act of 2009."

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private primary and intermediate schools with at least one hundred students.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make nurses available to public and private primary and intermediate schools with at least one hundred students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of aerosol spray paint cans and broad tipped indelible markers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Sale of aerosol spray paint cans and broad tipped indelible markers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to accepting legally blind applicants for New York city disability parking permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Accepting legally blind applicants for New York City Disability Parking Permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the conversion of residential buildings to other usage.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Conversion of residential buildings to other usage.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving the health and safety of nail salon employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Improving the health and safety of nail salon employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to extending the time limits during July and August for community board action with respect to the uniform land use review procedure.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Community Board Action Time Limits

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of State to promulgate standards and rules concerning the sanitization of mattresses that include requirements sufficient to eradicate bedbugs in reconditioned mattresses before their sale.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Promulgate standards and rules concerning the sanitization of mattresses that include requirements sufficient to eradicate bedbugs in reconditioned mattresses before their sale.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tickets to the general public by operators of theater, music, or sporting events taking place in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Sale of tickets to the general public by operators of theater, music, or sporting events taking place in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the life and legacy of legendary entertainer and civil rights activist, Lena Horne.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the life and legacy of legendary entertainer and civil rights activist, Lena Horne.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact H.R.3734, the “Urban Revitalization and Livable Communities Act,” which would authorize the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to establish and carry out an urban revitalization and livable communities program to provide federal grants to urban areas for the rehabilitation of critically needed recreational areas and facilities and development of improved recreation programs, and for other purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Congress to enact H.R.3734, the “Urban Revitalization and Livable Communities Act.”

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing reporting requirements for the department of citywide administrative services on the status of city-owned real property
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Establishing reporting requirements for the department of citywide administrative services on the status of city-owned real property.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of pending legislation in the New York State Legislature intended to strengthen regulations governing the sale and licensing of firearms.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Strengthen regulations governing the sale and licensing of firearms.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a task force on stepstreets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creation of a task force on stepstreets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to raising the sales age from eighteen to twenty-one years for cigarettes and tobacco products and establishing a sales age of twenty-one years for electronic cigarettes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Raising the legal tobacco products sales age to twenty-one years.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the payment of a living wage to employees employed on property developed by recipients of financial assistance for economic development.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring the payment of a living wage to employees employed on property developed by recipients of financial assistance for economic development.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the City from unnecessarily purchasing bottled water.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the City from unnecessarily purchasing bottled water.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to report on complaints of harassment in the transit system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD to report on complaints of harassment in the transit system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to reconcile and pass A.10163 and S.8380 and the Governor to sign into law, an act to amend the Labor Law in relation to establishing the Wage Theft Prevention Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Establishing the Wage Theft Prevention Act. (A.10163/S.8380)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2010 Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2010 Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to unlawful sidewalk ATMs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Regulating sidewalk ATMs as revocable consents and requiring safety features for all outdoor ATMs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the annual report required by certain entities which enter into contracts with the department of small business services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Annual report required by certain entities which enter into contracts with the department of small business services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to amend the Community Reinvestment Act to provide credits to financial institutions that fund affordable middle-income housing construction projects that have stalled or suspended their activities due to a discontinuance of project funding.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Congress to amend the Community Reinvestment Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a Street Vendor Advisory Board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Creation of a Street Vendor Advisory Board.

Items.Title: Resolution to amend the text of the New York City Zoning Resolution to require a Special Permit to be granted by the City Planning Commission for the installation of telephone exchanges or communications equipment in Residence Districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Installation of telephone exchanges or communications equipment in Residence Districts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education (DOE) to institute a policy that would limit the aggregate amount of homework that is given to elementary and middle grade school children to approximately ten minutes per grade level on any given night, and would include a homework-free night to allow children to participate in other activities, exercise and spend quality time with their families.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dep't of Education to institute a policy that would limit the aggregate amount of homework that is given to elementary and middle grade school children to approximately ten minutes per grade level on any given night.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of pending legislation in the New York State Legislature intended to amend the penal law in relation to the offense of non-support of a child.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Offense of non-support of a child.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the time period for parking at parking meters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Limiting the time period for parking at parking meters.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 100155 HAK, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 277, 275 and 273 Kosciuszko Street and the disposition of such property, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 36.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 100156 ZSK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 36 to facilitate the development of a 6-story community facility with sleeping accommodations.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(3) of the Charter.

Items.MatterName: Zoning, CBC Associates and the South Bronx Overall EDC (C080157ZMX)

Items.Title: Application no. 20105516 HKM (N 100278 HKR), pursuant to §3020 of the Charter of the City of New York, concerning the designation (List No.427, LP-2384) by the Landmarks Preservation Commission of the Reformed church on Staten Island Sunday School Building and Cemetery, located at 54 Port Richmond Avenue, as a historic landmark, Council District no. 49.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, June 9, 2010.


MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
